summary: A majority of states have nondiscrimination protections for youth in foster care. But selected states and stakeholders identified challenges supporting youth with LGBTQ+ identities, and those who belong to various religious groups. Challenges include addressing bias among child welfare staff and caregivers, as well as recruiting foster families from religious minority groups. title: Foster Care: Further Assistance from HHS Would be Helpful in Supporting Youth's LGBTQ+ Identities and Religious Beliefs
